newsitem.title: PERU: Peru says cenbank bought $800 mln to date in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Peru says cenbank bought $800 mln to date in 1996.

text.p: Economy Minister Jorge Camet told Congress Wednesday Peru had bought so far this year $800 million on the local exchange market.
"In order to have a gradual improvement in the exchange rate projected for 1996, in the year to date -- reflecting a big effort by the treasury -- $800 million has been bought," Camet said.
In September, Camet estimated the Central Reserve Bank's foreign currency buying this year would total $900 million.
Camet has said the government's goal for an average exchange rate in 1996 is 2.40 soles to the dollar.
The central bank has been intervening in the local market this year to maintain a gradual depreciation of the sol.
The sol began the year at 2.30 to the dollar and is currently trading around 2.57.
The government has predicted an average annual rate of 2.70 soles to the dollar next year in its 1997 budget proposal.
